channel.title: Computers in Minecraft
channel.description:
http://www.minecraftforum.net/topic/892282-100-computercraft-12/
It adds a computer that has a command line OS to Minecraft, and allows you to actually program things to run in the game. What do you think about the idea?

item.title: Computers in Minecraft
item.dc:creator: @triston001 triston001
item.description:
@triston001 wrote:

its lua based programming, but if u must u could mix it with red circuiting, from the partner of this mod “red works”

Read full topic

item.title: Computers in Minecraft
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“triston001, post:30, topic:429034”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=531729.msg3992890#msg3992890 date=1336848121]

u can make programs in the computer. i’ve figured out how to work the redstone power part of it, like pulses, on off, DJ. i’ve also made a rock-paper-scissors program with it!

With the computercraft turtles i made a bridge that builds and destoys itself from a main console, it’s all wireless and the entreeway get’s airsealed if the bridge is open, 4 blocks wide, 4 turtles used, the turtles also return to their dock when the bridge get’s retracted and obviously seal it up. Can’t see any of it when they’re in the docking station.
Oh and the main console is controlled by 2 buttons, didn’t feel like typing shit or pressing a key.

and dam, wow…
[/quote]how do you get a random bit generator?

if im right in what your asking i would believe it would be math.random()[/quote]Sorry, every time I read this topic I assume you guys are talking about redstone circuits Programming it in is no fun.

Read full topic

item.title: Computers in Minecraft
item.dc:creator: @triston001 triston001
item.description:
@triston001 wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:29, topic:429034”][quote author=triston001 link=topic=531729.msg3992814#msg3992814 date=1336840943]
u can make programs in the computer. i’ve figured out how to work the redstone power part of it, like pulses, on off, DJ. i’ve also made a rock-paper-scissors program with it!

With the computercraft turtles i made a bridge that builds and destoys itself from a main console, it’s all wireless and the entreeway get’s airsealed if the bridge is open, 4 blocks wide, 4 turtles used, the turtles also return to their dock when the bridge get’s retracted and obviously seal it up. Can’t see any of it when they’re in the docking station.
Oh and the main console is controlled by 2 buttons, didn’t feel like typing shit or pressing a key.

and dam, wow…
[/quote]how do you get a random bit generator?[/quote]
if im right in what your asking i would believe it would be math.random()

Read full topic

could we set up an ingame e-mail server?
